title: Buzz the Music Quiz Ps2
description:
Manufacturer&#039;s Description
If you&#039;ve listened to the radio in the last fifty years and you know how to buzz, then you&#039;re all set to be the next contestant on Buzz: The Music Quiz
Buzz brings the music game-show to your living room, testing your music trivia and buzzer skills. Included with the game are a set of four bespoke buzzers which lets four people play right away, and provides an interface that even a techno-zero would understand.

&#039;Buzz&#039; is your host, complete with an all-knowing smile, a catchphrase, a glamorous assistant called &#039;Rose&#039; and his very own theme tune. You can select a playable contestant to suit your personal music taste, choose from 16 different characters including a pop diva, a rocker, a punk, an Elvis and a disco dude.

There are over 1,000 music clips--all international chart-toppers from the 1950s through to 2005--and over 5,000 questions to test your knowledge, either by playing solo in a fast paced single-player mode or with your friends in the multiplayer game. You can choose to play in short bursts, or over a longer period if you want to. All wins and losses can be saved to memory cards if you need to refer to them at a later date! 

There are eight different rounds that will give you the opportunity to prove your music muscle:

Point Builder: A nice simple round to start off with which lets you build up some points to lose or build on - in later rounds.
Snap: If you see the right answer appear onscreen, then Buzz in as fast as you can. Beware though; you&#039;ll need lightning reactions to beat your competitors.
Fastest Finger: The quicker you buzz, the more points you&#039;ll see.
Offloader: Whether you know the answer or not is irrelevant. More importantly, who do you think doesn&#039;t know? This is your opportunity to get your rivals to answer the questions you don&#039;t want to.
Pass the Bomb: Answer the question correctly to pass the bomb to the next contestant, but don&#039;t get caught holding it as it goes off.
Point Stealer:Time to seek revenge on those that have crossed you in the past.
Buzz Stop: Good hand-eye co-ordination and an aptitude for inane trivia are all that&#039;s required for this round. This is a pass or play round, so Buzz in if you want no-one else to have the chance to answer the question if you know it, and pass if you don&#039;t.
Look Before You Leap:The final round, so there is everything to play for here. Buzz in as soon as you know the answer, but watch out as hastiness could be a bad move: if you don&#039;t know the answer, you&#039;ll lose points.
Tie-Breaker: And finally, a game-show would not be a game-show without the ubiquitous Tie-Breaker
